reviews.review_msg: Diana is a great prof. She really cares abut the students and will take the time to help you. But the labs and term project are difficult and take a lot of time. Go to her office hours and the TA's too. She will give you a good grade but will make you work for it.

extremely tough course, and workload is large + unclear instruction for lab assignment (over 12 hours/lab), means you need to attend all the labs and ask questions. Midterm and final are tough too. The course includes a individual term project that I felt unreasonable as the 5 weeks of software works were not graded (only writing's graded).

Diana Allen sure knows her stuff and makes you work for every single grade percentage. Taking EASC315W was extremely tough, as it's basically a chemistry course added to a writing course. The midterm was different this year, it was all written. The highest mark was a 71% with an average of 40%. This course is not for the faint of heart.
